text: I'm Andrew Nolan the restaurant and
drinks editor at Bon Appetit magazine
and today I'm going to show you how to
make a classic daiquiri not the frozen
kind not the one that you could find on
Bourbon Street
serve just the way Papa Hemingway would
have had it in Cuba where it was
invented here's how to make it so first
we're gonna start with the crucial
ingredient white rum silver rum if all
you have is dark rum that works just as
well this is called a Boston shaker
always do it in the glass half so you
can see what you're doing and then we're
just gonna move into freshly squeezed
lime juice 3/4 of an ounce and then a
little bit of simple syrup the same
amount 3/4 of an ounce and that's
basically all there is to a classic
daiquiri so then it's time for the ice a
crucial ingredient in cocktails you want
big ice cubes because you don't want too
much dilution but you do want dilution
because most cocktails at least 1/4 of
the drink is water so then you just put
the lid on and you just want to give it
a hard whack on top and you can kind of
feel there'll be a little bit of suction
and you should be able to lift it and a
deal a shake it for 10 to 15 seconds the
key is you want it to get cold you want
the ice a diver you can kind of feel
when it's you can feel the Zen when the
cocktail is ready there's a pretty good
seal on here so all you want to do is
take the palm of your hand and just
whack it on the edge and you can hear
that actually pop just swish it back
here and then for this drink I like a
classic coupe glass Hawthorne strainer
which is just a strainer fits right on
the lift of your pint glass and that's
pretty much it simple cocktail all the
good ones usually are and then you don't
even have to garnish it if you don't
want I like a little bit of just a lime
wheel on top and there you have it
classic daiquiri a good daiquiri should
make you good late for these cocktail
recipes and more go to Bon Appetit com1
try it
21 she's turned 21 on Saturday
